lead_paragraph: After her shift at the TraXside Cafe in the southeast North Dakota hamlet of Enderlin, all Karla Souer wants to do is go home. Unfortunately for the 38-year-old waitress the commute, which should only last a minute or two, can take a half-an-hour. That's because, chances are, there's a Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd train blocking the tracks somewhere on her route.

headline.main: Why a Small North Dakota Town Is Taking on Big Rail
headline.print_headline: Why a Small North Dakota Town Is Taking on Big Rail
